meanings.definition: Cause (something unpleasant or painful) to be suffered by someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The bully inflicts pain on others by hitting them.
meanings.sent2: The storm inflicts damage on the houses in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten inflicts chaos by knocking over the flower vase.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter inflicts its icy grip on the small town.
meanings.sent5: The illness inflicts a heavy toll on the elderly population.

meanings.definition: Impose something unwelcome or harmful on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher inflicts extra homework on the students who misbehave.
meanings.sent2: The new law inflicts fines on those who break it.
meanings.sent3: The prankster inflicts a silly hat on his unsuspecting friend.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive regime inflicts fear on its citizens.
meanings.sent5: The noisy construction work inflicts disturbances on the peaceful neighborhood.
